text.__SUMMARY__: Gymnopilus fulgens is a species of mushroom in the Cortinariaceae family. It was given its current name by mycologist Rolf Singer in 1951.
text.Description: The cap is 0.5 to 2.5 centimetres (0.2 to 1.0 in) in diameter.
text.Habitat and distribution: Gymnopilus fulgens grows among moss, on peaty soil, charred sphagnum, or burned-over soil. In the United States, it has been collected in Michigan, but it has also been found in Europe. It fruits from June to September.
